title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace Court", ca. 1800
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, over black chalk on thick paper, lined with cream or light brown paper
markings: Cooper Union Museum stamp on the verso
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a stage set.  Stairs leading up into enormously high vaulted interior.  Large arched openings lead into further spaces.  Colonnaded clerestories and walkways in upper parts of the interiors.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace Court", ca. 1800.
ca. 1800. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, over black chalk on thick paper, lined with cream or light brown paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-417.
